title: Do you think the world will ever be the same as it once was after the COVID-19 pandemic? - Quora

response.answer_text: The world returned to normal uninhibited interactions after the 1919 Spanish Flu pandemic because for the next hundred years there were only occasional, local epidemics such as polio that could be brought under control. If the COVID-19 pandemic turns out to be the first of an ongoing series of worldwide pandemics, then our ability to interact with our neighbors and the rest of the world will be qualitatively different from this moment of history. We will be living from one vaccine to the next isolated by an invisible, ever-present lethal threat over which we will have only minimal control. Given the history of epidemics over the past 50 years, the latter scenario seems more likely don’t you think?
